item.title: Analysis of Variance - Terminology
item.dc:creator: Marco Hassan
item.description:
This is the first post making notes on the ANOVA - analysis of variance.

The basic research question of the study of the ANOVA is how to compare different research outputs and how to assess whether the difference among two or more group outcomes are statistically significant or rather the result of randomness. In this sense a special attention is given to the experimental error, which represent the natural variation and error observed in an untouched environment from the unconditioned underlying data generating process. Just with this notion of "true/underlying" randomness the interpretation of the results is sensible.

This first post, starts to explore the above by making the point of the difficulties underlying such studies and the importance of the experimental settings which the researcher is exposed to.

Read more… (3 min remaining to read)
